channel.title: Visualization on Dental Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in Visualization on Dental Data Science

item.title: Visualizing the dentists workforce of OECD countries
item.author: sergio.uribe@gmail.com (Sergio Uribe)
item.description: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development host a database with extensive data. IN this post we will some visualizations to compare the number of dentists in each country. Package required: tidyverse First we load the data. Now there is a package (OECD) able to extract the datasets, but I will use a local copy: dent_oecd <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vStv7Pr69DtRKv6Nw6gVBep8hbT3pEeO6B1vNwxK_1DUHgpoTgbuRpZ4SvgtHFQnBZJVGeeQVyRuXZl/pub?gid=1330297229&single=true&output=csv") ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## VAR = col_character(), ## Variable = col_character(), ## UNIT = col_character(), ## Measure = col_character(), ## COU = col_character(), ## Country = col_character(), ## YEA = col_integer(), ## Year = col_integer(), ## Value = col_double(), ## `Flag Codes` = col_character(), ## Flags = col_character() ## ) Always is preferable to take a look the data and its structure:

item.title: Visualizing caries trend at age 12 from OECD dataset
item.author: sergio.uribe@gmail.com (Sergio Uribe)
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.2.1 -- ## v ggplot2 2.2.1 v purrr 0.2.4 ## v tibble 1.4.2 v dplyr 0.7.4 ## v tidyr 0.8.0 v stringr 1.3.0 ## v readr 1.1.1 v forcats 0.3.0 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() df <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vStv7Pr69DtRKv6Nw6gVBep8hbT3pEeO6B1vNwxK_1DUHgpoTgbuRpZ4SvgtHFQnBZJVGeeQVyRuXZl/pub?gid=1485746444&single=true&output=csv") ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## Country = col_character(), ## DMFT_12_2006 = col_double(), ## DentistsPer1000h = col_double() ## ) head(df) ## # A tibble: 6 x 3 ## Country DMFT_12_2006 DentistsPer1000h ## <chr> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 Australia 1.

item.title: Visualization of categorical data in dental research
item.author: sergio.uribe@gmail.com (Sergio Uribe)
item.description: Categorical data is often found in dental research reports. From the clinical perspective, itâ€™s easier to deal and understand since many clinical decisions are categorical: does this surface has caries? have this patient active caries? should I give a treatment? Usually, this data are presented in tables, but there are some visualizations helpful to discover some associations. For example, a survey research investigate the perception of children and their mothers as regards orthodontic treatment need and satisfaction with dental aesthetics (De Souza et al.
